intro: Echites tweedieanus, commonly known as the Tweedie's echites, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, giving it a delicate appearance. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
